item.title: Coupling Friction with Visual Appearance
item.description: S Andrews, L Nassif, K Erleben, PG Kry Abstract We present a novel meso-scale model for computing anisotropic and asymmetric friction for contacts in rigid body simulations that is based on surface facet orientations. The main idea behind our approach is to compute a direction dependent friction coefficient that is determined by an objectâ€™s roughness. Specifically, where the friction is dependent on asperity interlocking, but at a scale where surface roughness is also a visual characteristic of the surface.
